intro: Spermacoce galapageia, commonly known as the Galapagos morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique climate of the Galápagos. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
